intro: Oenothera deltoides subsp. deltoides, commonly known as the evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening, hence its common name. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous small, oval seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in prairies, disturbed areas, and along roadsides. Oenothera deltoides subsp. deltoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine.
